header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Engineering, houses, birds, pensions, money, heating, land registry, TV licence

body.u: saw the packages when he was supposed to sort them out
and er there'd be perhaps about thirty-odd pack in a trolley or something

and then you know we started about eight o'clock and then at midnight the midnight train would come in and we'd have to unload some more trolleys you know depending it could be about another ten or twenty or thirty even sometimes

and er we're suppose to spend all night sorting out these trolleys right? well we'd get in there at eight and there'd only about two of us there three of us and we start sorting these trolleys out and this guy he was he wasn't the boss but he was sort of like the big brash bloke telling everyone what to do
we used to have this sort of rule that you weren't allowed to do more than twelve twelve trolleys
then we used to stop by which time it was about ten o'clock and then we'd kip down for a couple of hours till the train come in
and then we'd unload them trolleys just stash them away then we'd kip down for another couple of hours
and then well then we had to go upstairs after that and you know an hour before we went cos I used to get a lot of catalogues and things
cos there was two big erm you know sort of er what do you call them? these ah catalogue houses
you know and they used to ship out all these thousands of catalogues

and we had to put them into the areas where we went to and then bind them up into bundles and there were always thous stacks and stacks of these things to go out but we'd only do it about you know an hour or less and then we'd go home at night you could easily clear the whole bloody lot
could easily have done if you worked right through
